analyzed: vuttam ha etam bhagavatā vuttam arahatā iti me suta
translated: This was said by the Blessed One, said by the Arahant, so I have heard:
“Monks, there are these three kinds of good conduct.

analyzed: kāya su carita vacī su carita manaḥ su carita
translated: Good conduct by way of body, good conduct by way of speech, good conduct by way of mind.

original: imāni kho, bhikkhave, tīṇi sucaritānī”ti.🔽Etamatthaṁ bhagavā avoca.
analyzed: imāni kho bhikkhave tīṇi su caritāni iti  etam attham bhagavān avoca
translated: These are the three kinds of good conduct.”🔽The Blessed One said this.
And in connection with this, it was said:
“Having abandoned bad conduct by way of body,
and bad conduct by way of speech,🔽and bad conduct by way of mind,🔽and whatever else is associated with faults,

analyzed: hitvā  yat caññam dosa sahita  a katvā a kusalam kamma
translated: having not done any bad action,
and having done much good action,
the one with discernment, with the breakup of the body,

original: Ayampi attho vutto bhagavatā, iti me sutanti.
analyzed: ayam pi atthaḥ vuttaḥ bhagavatā iti me sutam ti
translated: This is the meaning of what the Blessed One said. So it was heard by me.
